summary: P.S. Repost, since I replaced the scanned pictures with a photograph, as it looks closer to the original even if not the same,...
caption:
P.S. Repost, since I replaced the scanned pictures with a photograph, as it looks closer to the original even if not the same, less detailed and smoother, but colours are good… and it is morning…  and the scan was horrible and fixative not yet set… 

“Rebirth”

Oil pastels on light green paper. I actually managed to get a new pack of oil pastels before finishing this picture - this time artist quality ones by Talens, that is soft, smooth and smearing… it was very helpful, so hopefully with more experience it will do what i want it to do… but hey, at least I am getting better at hands xD

I am very fond of both snakes and Voldemort’s snake-human form. Frankly, they are the cutest, prettiest creatures, so every time I am drawing Voldemort I am like - here comes the Babe! This time I was particularly inspired by a story I recently read, where Voldemort’s skin was compared to the snow coloured by light, as well as mother-of-pearl. I tried to blend all kind of pastel colours to get that effect. Harry is still pretty young (and a Harry that just helped Voldemort to come back. Actually, it could very well be my Harry from the next chapter of “One and Only” if I ever manage to write it).

reblog.comment:

summary:
Ron: Hey geez! This thing moves on its own!
Hermione: Yes! And it's called magic. 
Harry: I told you not to practice spells on...
body:
Ron: Hey geez! This thing moves on its own!

Hermione: Yes! And it’s called magic.

Harry: I told you not to practice spells on him, Hermione 🙄

Ron: Check that out! There are talking rats too!!

___________________________________

blog.name: drarry-imagines
blog.title: Harry x Draco Imagines
blog.description:
Header image by @scarlet47 [PERMISSION BY ARTIST GRANTED]

This blog is a Bottom!Draco blog Only. Feel free to send prompts and and suggestions. I would be posting NSFW, one-shots, prompts and more.

Side Pairings that’ll appear: Pansmione, Roneville, Wolfstar, Linny.

question: 26, 45 & 50 from the Hogwarts ask thing
answer:
26. Lowkey ships?

I secretly ship any male character with Draco, but my main lowkey ship would be Fred x Draco x George.

45. Favorite minor character?

I’d say Cho Chang but that’s only because I’m super G A Y for her.

50. Who would your BFF be?

Not even joking but I’d be best friends with Draco Malfoy, I’m not even being biased, he’s just the type I’d like talking to.

reblog.comment:

blog.description: incorrect quotes (or are they totally correct?) said by the professors of hogwarts school of witchcraft and wizardry. (brought to you by the admins of incorrect-marauders.)

summary:
McGonagall: So you lied to me.
Harry: Well that depends on how you define "lying."
McGonagall: I define is as not telling the...
body:
McGonagall: So you lied to me.
Harry: Well that depends on how you define "lying."
McGonagall: I define is as not telling the truth. How do you define it?
Harry: Reclining your body in a horizontal position?

dialogue.name: Harry
dialogue.label: Harry:
dialogue.phrase: Well that depends on how you define "lying."

summary: You know what, I’m always the first to tear myself down but I have the coherency to say that the thing I’m most proud of myself...
body:
You know what, I’m always the first to tear myself down but I have the coherency to say that the thing I’m most proud of myself (aside from scholastic results) is that I’ve never dared to see the HP movies before having read the books. So, sticking to this wonderful rule of mine, I have now my own headcanon about how all the characters looked and plenty of designs to work on. And the movie casting will never ruin them.

That’s it. The only time in my life I have been smart … If you consider smart reading the HP books for the very first time at the tender age of 19 and then seeing all the movies to brag about how not faithful they were, yes I’ve been smart.

So, sticking to this wonderful rule of mine, I have now my own headcanon about how all the characters looked and plenty of designs to work on. And the movie casting will never ruin them.

That’s it. The only time in my life I have been smart … If you consider smart reading the HP books for the very first time at the tender age of 19 and then seeing all the movies to brag about how not faithful they were, yes I’ve been smart.
